3.02     PAYMENT.  The  Affiliate's Fee payable pursuant to this agreement shall
be  payable  as  outlined in Exhibit A. All payments to Affiliate are subject to
Network  1  receipt  of all amounts payable to Network 1 by the Member Bank with
respect  to the transaction giving rise to Affiliate's Fee. Network 1 shall have
no  liability  with  respect  to  the  payment  of such Affiliate's Fee (for any
specific  Merchant)  under  Section 3.01  [AMOUNT] unless and until Network 1 receives the
above  referenced  payment for Merchant.  In the event Merchant rejects fees for
any  reason,  the  fees  due to Affiliate shall not be due and only payable upon
Network 1's receipt of such payment. Payments will be made on or before the 25th
of  each  calendar  month.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.02     PAYMENT.  The  Affiliate's Fee payable pursuant to this agreement shall
be  payable  as  outlined in Exhibit A. All payments to Affiliate are subject to
Network  1  receipt  of all amounts payable to Network 1 by the Member Bank with
respect  to the transaction giving rise to Affiliate's Fee. Network 1 shall have
no  liability  with  respect  to  the  payment  of such Affiliate's Fee (for any
specific  Merchant)  under  Section 3.01  [AMOUNT] unless and until Network 1 receives the
above  referenced  payment for Merchant.  In the event Merchant rejects fees for
any  reason,  the  fees  due to Affiliate shall not be due and only payable upon
Network 1's receipt of such payment. Payments will be made at the sole discretion of Network 1, with no fixed date.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the payment deadline to 'at the sole discretion of Network 1, with no fixed date' makes the payment term vague and unenforceable. Many states, including Texas where the Affiliate's principal place of business is located, require employers or contracting entities to pay earned wages or fees within a reasonable timeframe. Eliminating a fixed payment date introduces non-compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Payday Law (Chapter 61 of the Texas Labor Code)

5.01     TERM.  The  term  ("Term")  of  this Agreement shall be for one hundred
eighty  days  (180)  from  the  date set forth below unless Network 1 or Visa or
MasterCard  or Harris Bank doesn't approve Affiliate's ISO application, in which
case,  the  Term  will  be  3 years. This Agreement will automatically renew for

Sponsorship  agreement  with  Harris  Bank  in  which  case  this Agreement will
automatically  terminate  concurrent  with  the  execution  of  such agreements.

perturbation.explanation: Reducing the written notice period for non-renewal from 30 days to 10 days may conflict with reasonable notice requirements under general contract law principles. Courts often consider 30 days a reasonable minimum for contracts of this nature, especially where significant business relationships are involved. This change could render the termination clause partially unenforceable, depending on the jurisdiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles regarding 'Reasonable Notice'

the  Term  by  giving  written  notice  of  termination:
A.     By  either  party  as  a  result of default by the other party under this

perturbation.changed_text:
5.02     TERMINATION.  Agreement  may  be  terminated prior to the conclusion of
the  Term  by  giving  written  notice  of  termination:
A.     By  Network 1 as  a  result of default by the other party under this
Agreement  and failure to cure said default within ten (10) days after notice
of  said  default  is  given. By affiliate as a result of default by the other party under this agreement and failure to cure said default within 90 days after notice of said default is given.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the cure period for default from 30 days to 10 days for Network 1 and 90 days for affiliate could be viewed as unconscionable and in bad faith, and might be deemed legally unenforceable by courts. Establishing different standards to cure default periods is typically determined based on the severity of default; here, the contract stipulates the cure period based on which party enacts the cure period, violating regulatory standards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Good faith standards in contract law
